text: I chose studying in the healthcare engineering mainly because of what we can do with technologies nowadays. The ressources put in the R&D in this field is so massive all around the world, I think that it is impressive. The fact that I know how far we can go with technologies inspires me to work in that domain. Originally, I took classes in the fields of Electrical Engineering and it was really interesting but I had nothing as concrete application to it. I was studying electronics, programming, etc. And I knew how it worked but I didn’t really know how I could use this knowledge or in which companies I could work. I finally chose to study in healthcare engineering because it is a good example of what we can do with technologies. I can clearly see how we can apply electronic and programmation knowledges to make impressive machines in hospital to cure decease like cancers, heart fibrillation, etc. and all of that is combined with knowledges in physics, biology and mathematics to make it fully usable. Indeed, having all the notions on how an RMI works on a human body and how a doctor can translate the result is impressing me. Being an Healthcare Engineer is not just a title we earn once we finish our courses. Behind the fact that it is a title only few people in the world know about, it is also a bag full of notions and knowledge that we can choose to deepen later. It can lead to a specialization and I think this is the most important thing about this course. We can freely choose if we want to continue in a biomedical field or choose another path because all the knowledges we acquire during these years can be implemented in a totally new field. And the fact that we can move freely between specializations is what motivates me the most and I appreciate that because I know I can move on if it doesn’t suit me and all the things I learned will not be lost.
